intro.text: An open project to collaboratively map the Amazon in OpenStreetMap

about.title: About Mapazonia
content: Mapazonia has the aim of improving the OSM data in the Amazon region, using satellite images to map the geometry of roads and rivers.
Detailed cartography will help many organizations that are working in the Amazon to accomplish their objectives. Together we can collaborate to look after the Amazon and its inhabitants.
The project was born as an initiative of the Latin American OpenStreetMap Community with the objective of pushing ahead collaborative mapping of common areas and problems in the continent.

We use the Tasking Manager of the Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team to define the areas where we are going to work. Furthermore we will organize mapathons to teach the people how to use the tools of collaborative mapping.

openstreetmap.title: OpenStreetMap
content: OpenStreetMap is an editable map of the whole world, which is being built largely from scratch, and released with an open content license.
The OpenStreetMap License allows free (or almost free) access to map images and all of underlying map data, and the project aims to promote new and interesting uses of this data.

contact.title: Contact Us
content: If you want to participate please get in contact with us.
You can help mapping, sponsoring or just spreading the word about the project.
